name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.kiosk.appsconfig.AutoLaunchApp
policyDescription: Allows setting of the auto-launch app.

fieldDescriptions.description: Id of the app prefixed with one of either "chrome:" or "web:", depending on the app type. For Chrome apps, the app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb". For Web apps, the app id is simply the URL, example: "web:https://translate.google.com".
Enables health monitoring of the auto launch app, which will alert you if it crashes.
Sets the rotation angle for the auto launch app.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.InstallType
policyDescription: Specified the manner in which the app is to be installed.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with one of "android:", "chrome:" or "web:", depending on the app type. For Android apps, the app id can be found on the Google Play store, example: "android:com.google.android.apps.translate". For Chrome apps, the app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb". For Web apps, the app id is simply the URL, example: "web:https://translate.google.com".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls how the app is to be installed.

notices.noticeMessage: Android apps can only be installed in the device if policy 'chrome.users.appsconfig.AndroidAppsEnabled' has 'arc_enabled' set to true.
Android apps can only be installed in the device if policy 'chrome.users.appsconfig.AndroidAppsEnabled' has 'arc_enabled' set to true.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.IncludeInChromeWebStoreCollection
policyDescription: Specifies whether the Chrome Application should appear in the Chrome Web Store collection.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with "chrome:". The app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a Chrome Application should appear in the Chrome Web Store collection.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.CertificateManagement
policyDescription: Allows setting of certificate management related permissions.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with one of "android:" or "chrome:", depending on the app type. For Android apps, the app id can be found on the Google Play store, example: "android:com.google.android.apps.translate". For Chrome apps, the app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether the app can access client keys.
Controls whether the app can challenge enterprise keys.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.PermissionsAndUrlAccess
policyDescription: Allows setting of allowed and blocked hosts.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with "chrome:". The app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb".

fieldDescriptions.description: Sets extension permissions that should be blocked. If this field is set 'allowedPermissions' must be unset.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow all permissions. If empty string is set, it must be the only value set for the policy.

fieldDescriptions.description: Sets extension permissions that should be allowed. If this field is set 'blockedPermissions' must be unset.
Sets extension hosts that should be blocked.
Sets extension hosts that should be allowed. Allowed hosts override blocked hosts.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.ManagedConfiguration
policyDescription: Allows setting of the managed configuration.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with one of "android:" or "chrome:", depending on the app type. For Android apps, the app id can be found on the Google Play store, example: "android:com.google.android.apps.translate". For Chrome apps, the app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb".

fieldDescriptions.description: Sets the managed configuration JSON format.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.DefaultLaunchContainer
policyDescription: Allows setting of the default launch container for web apps.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with "web:". The app id is simply the URL, example: "web:https://translate.google.com".

fieldDescriptions.description: Sets the default launch container for web apps.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.SkipPrintConfirmation
policyDescription: Allows the app to skip the confirmation dialog when sending print jobs via the Chrome Printing API.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with "chrome:". The app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a Chrome Application can skip the confirmation dialog when sending print jobs via the Chrome Printing API.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.devices.managedguest.apps.InstallationUrl
policyDescription: Specifies the url from which to install a self hosted Chrome Extension.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with "chrome:". The id must consist of only lowercase letters, example: "chrome:selfhostedextensionid".

fieldDescriptions.description: The url from which to install a self hosted Chrome Extension.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with one of either "chrome:" or "web:", depending on the app type. For Chrome apps, the app id can be found on the Chrome Web Store, example: "chrome:aapbdbdomjkkjkaonfhkkikfgjllcleb". For Web apps, the app id is simply the URL, example: "web:https://translate.google.com".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether an app is force installed.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Do not force install the app.

notices.noticeMessage: In order for web apps to work properly in Kiosk, all permissions will be granted without requesting end users’ consent (for example, permissions to access the camera and microphone). Therefore, you should only add web apps that you fully trust. If you add a web app in Kiosk, please note that permissions will be automatically granted only when they are requested from the web app origin. Permission requests from a different origin will be automatically rejected. Therefore, we recommend ensuring that the specified URL does not have redirects. Permissions used by the web app may change over time. Any new permission will be automatically granted, provided they are requested from the web app origin. Permissions will be granted or rejected as mentioned above without notifying you or the end user.
Android apps can only be installed in the device if policy 'chrome.users.appsconfig.AndroidAppsEnabled' has 'arc_enabled' set to true.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of the app prefixed with one of either "chrome:" or "web:", depending on the app type. For Web apps, the app id is simply the URL, example: "web:https://translate.google.com".

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a Kiosk app is allowed to manage power.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.printers.AllowForUsers
policyDescription: Allows a printer for users in a given organization.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a printer is allowed for users in a given organization.

policyDescription: Allows a printer for devices in a given organization.

policyDescription: Allows a printer for Managed Guest in a given organization.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of printer as visible in Admin SDK printers API.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a printer is for Managed Guest in a given organization.
Maximum session length. 1 - 1440 minutes; leave empty for unlimited sessions.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Duration policy field value is in the range [1, 1440] (unit in minute).

fieldDescriptions.description: Uploaded file can be one of the MIME types: [image/jpeg], and file size cannot exceed 512kb.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The URI can be obtained by uploading your file via the upload service.

fieldDescriptions.description: Uploaded file can be one of the MIME types: [image/jpeg], and file size cannot exceed 16384kb.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The URI can be obtained by uploading your file via the upload service.

fieldDescriptions.description: Hex color. Enter a valid hex color, for instance #FFFFFF.
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Force users to sign-in to use the browser.

fieldDescriptions.description: Pattern. A regular expression which is used to determine which Google accounts can be set as browser primary accounts in Google Chrome (i.e. the account that is chosen during the Sync opt-in flow). For example, the value .*@example.com would restrict sign in to accounts in the example.com domain.
N/A
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Show the display password button on the login and lock screen.
Do not show the display password button on the login and lock screen.

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Apply supported user settings to Chrome on Android.
Do not apply supported user settings to Chrome on Android.

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Place Chrome device in user organization.
Keep Chrome device in current location.

notices.noticeMessage: Placing a device in a user organization during manual enrollment will give the Chrome device the device-level policies set for that organizational unit, such as settings for Cloud Print, Networks, Kiosk, and Sign-in Restrictions. Learn More About Device Settings at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678. If you choose to not enable this policy, devices will appear in the top-level organization when you enroll them. Devices can later be moved manually in the Admin Console or by changing the orgUnitPath with the API. Learn More About Enrollment at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1360534.

fieldDescriptions.description: Populate asset ID and location fields during enrollment.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Users in this organization can provide asset ID and location during enrollment.
Do not allow for users in this organization.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allow users in this OU to enroll existing devices. Enrollment permissions will only take effect on devices that have been configured to re-enroll with manual credential entry. Learn more at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users in this organization to enroll new or re-enroll existing devices.
Only allow users in this organization to re-enroll existing devices (cannot enroll new or deprovisioned devices).
Do not allow users in this organization to enroll new or re-enroll existing devices.

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users to end processes with the Chrome task manager.
Block users from ending processes with the Chrome task manager.

fieldDescriptions.description: Isolated site origins. Enter a list of origins to isolate, for instance https://mail.com or https://login.example.com. One pattern per line.
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Turn on site isolation for all websites.
Turn off site isolation for all websites, except those set in 'isolateOrigins'.

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow user to choose to enable site isolation.
Turn on site isolation for all websites.
Turn off site isolation for all websites, except those set in 'isolateOriginsAndroid'.

fieldDescriptions.description: Isolated site origins (Android). Enter a list of origins to isolate, for instance https://mail.com or https://login.example.com. One pattern per line.
N/A

notices.noticeMessage: If you turn on ephemeral mode, we strongly recommend that you set the 'chrome.users.appsconfig.AndroidAppsEnabled' setting to 'arcEnabled=false'. Otherwise, session startup is significantly impacted. For details, read the best practices guide at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/9962839.

fieldDescriptions.description: Online OCSP/CRL checks.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Do not perform online OCSP/CRL checks.

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow sites to detect users' geolocation.
Do not allow sites to detect users' geolocation.
Always ask the user if a site wants to detect their geolocation.

fieldDescriptions.description: Force online login flow for Google accounts. 0–365 days. A value of 0 means that online login will always be required. Leave empty to not require regular online logins. Note: This setting does not afford any additional at-rest protection of user data stored on the Chrome device.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to 0, and should have value less than or equal to 365.

fieldDescriptions.description:
Force online unlock flow for Google accounts. 0–365 days. A value of 0 means that online login will always be required. Leave empty to not require regular online logins.
Note: This setting does not afford any additional at-rest protection of user data stored on the Chrome device.
Recommendation: Please make sure that online unlocks are required equally or less often than online logins.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to -2, and should have value less than or equal to 365.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.SingleSignOn

fieldDescriptions.description: SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome OS devices. Please set up SSO for Google Workspace before using this policy: https://support.google.com/a/answer/60224.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome devices.
Disable SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome devices.

accessRestrictions: You must have Google Workspace SSO enabled for your domain in order to control this policy.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.SingleSignOnLoginFrequency

fieldDescriptions.description: Force online login flow for SAML-based single sign-on accounts. Please set up SSO for Google Workspace and activate single sign-on for Chrome device users before using this policy: https://support.google.com/a/answer/60224.

accessRestrictions: You must have Google Workspace SSO enabled for your domain in order to control this policy.

fieldDescriptions.description:
Force online unlock for SAML based Single Sign-On accounts. 0–365 days. A value of 0 means that online login will always be required. Leave empty to not require regular online logins.
Note: Please set up SSO for Google Workspace and activate single sign-on for Chrome device users before using this policy.
Recommendation: Please make sure that online unlocks are required equally or less often than online logins.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to -2, and should have value less than or equal to 365.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed certificate transparency URLs. Any URL listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. Enter one URL per line. Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForUrls.

Certificate transparency CA allowlist. Any subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. These hashes must be listed in a particular format. Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForCas.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be prefixed with "sha256/".

fieldDescriptions.description: Certificate transparency legacy CA allowlist. Any subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. These hashes must be listed in a particular format and must match a recognized Legacy Certificate Authority. Enter Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForLegacyCas.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be prefixed with "sha256/".

fieldDescriptions.description: Action on security token removal (e.g. smart card).

Removal notification duration (seconds). A notification informing the user of the impending action is displayed for this many seconds.  This notification is blocking the screen.  The action will only happen after this notification expires.  The user can prevent the action by re-inserting the security token before the notification expires.  Set to 0 to disable the notification and have the action happen immediately.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Duration policy field value is in the range [0, 9999] (unit in second).

fieldDescriptions.description: N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow system notifications to be used.
Do not allow system notifications to be used.

fieldDescriptions.description: Enable kerberos.

Principal name. Define a Kerberos account to be added on behalf of user. The following placeholders are supported: - ${LOGIN_ID}: Username part of principal, e.g. "user" if the user logs in as "user@REALM"- ${LOGIN_EMAIL}: Full principal, e.g. "user@REALM" if the user logs in as "user@REALM".
Kerberos configuration.
Enable kerberos automatically.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls
policyDescription: WebRTC ICE candidate URLs for local IPs.

fieldDescriptions.description: URLs for which local IPs are exposed in WebRTC ICE candidates. . Patterns in this list will be matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If a match is found the local IP addresses are shown in WebRTC ICE candidates. Otherwise, local IP addresses are concealed with mDNS hostnames. Please note that this policy weakens the protection of local IPs if needed by administrators. .
N/A
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: WebRTC will use all available interfaces when searching for the best path.
WebRTC will only use the interface connecting to the public Internet, but may connect using private IP addresses.
WebRTC will only use the interface connecting to the public Internet, and will not connect using private IP addresses.
WebRTC will use TCP on the public-facing interface, and will only use UDP if supported by a configured proxy.

fieldDescriptions.description: DNS-over-HTTPS mode.

knownValueDescriptions.description: May send DNS-over-HTTPS requests to user's configured custom name server.

fieldDescriptions.description: DNS-over-HTTPS templates. URI templates of desired DNS-over-HTTPS resolvers. If the URI template contains a '{?dns}' variable, requests to the resolver will use GET; otherwise requests will use POST.
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Use the built-in DNS client on macOS, Android and Chrome OS. Allow the user to change the setting.
Always use the built-in DNS client if available.
Never use the built-in DNS client.

fieldDescriptions.description: Activate Always-on VPN for all user traffic with an app from a list of force installed Android VPN apps. Please make sure the configured app is force installed.
N/A

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow user to disconnect from a VPN manually (VPN will reconnect on log in).
Do not allow user to disconnect from a VPN manually.
